decks.notes: This Boros Aggro deck focuses on a fast, aggressive playstyle, utilizing cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah, Amped Raptor, and Lightning Bolt to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The deck also includes synergistic cards like Guide of Souls and Ocelot Pride to strengthen the board presence and overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion provides additional flexibility and mana acceleration. Blood Moon and Static Prison disrupt the opponent's game plan, while cards like The One Ring and Goblin Bombardment offer additional win conditions. Overall, the deck aims to win quickly through aggressive creature attacks and burn spells.

This deck focuses on utilizing a wide range of aggressive creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By including the companion Jegantha, the Wellspring, the deck gains access to additional mana and a powerful finisher. The main deck includes a mix of efficient creatures like Territorial Kavu and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, as well as versatile spells like Tribal Flames and Lightning Bolt. Leyline of the Guildpact and Stubborn Denial provide protection and disruption, while Scion of Draco and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury offer powerful late game threats. The land base is designed to support the deck's multicolored spells.

This Mardu Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creature play and removal spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes cards that provide additional value through sacrificing creatures, protection with Static Prison, and efficient removal spells like Galvanic Discharge and Thoughtseize. The deck aims to apply early pressure with creatures like Amped Raptor and Ocelot Pride, supported by powerful planeswalker Ajani, Nacatl Pariah. Additionally, the inclusion of Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury offers a big finisher to close out games. With a mix of creature aggression and versatile removal, this deck aims to close out games quickly and decisively.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using Eldrazi Temple and other mana sources, while controlling the board with cards like All Is Dust and Ugin's Labyrinth. The deck aims to play powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, Ulamog, and Devourer of Destiny, using cards like Through the Breach to cheat them into play. The deck also includes ways to search for key cards like Ancient Stirrings and utilize powerful lands like Boseiju, Who Endures. Overall, the deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with big threats and controlling the game's tempo.

The main theme of this deck is to efficiently ramp up mana, utilizing the combo of Amulet of Vigor and bounce lands to generate huge amounts of mana quickly. This allows you to play powerful cards like Primeval Titan and Scapeshift to search for key lands and overwhelm your opponent with massive creatures. The deck also includes a variety of utility lands to further support the combo strategy, making it a potent and versatile threat in the Modern format.

This deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence with aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Scion of Draco, while controlling the opponent's resources with counterspells like Force of Negation and Leyline Binding. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Fatal Push and Leyline of the Guildpact to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of powerful cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury adds an additional win condition. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the diverse color requirements of the deck while maintaining consistency.

This deck focuses on assembling a toolbox of creatures that can be searched for and played to create powerful combos. The deck utilizes cards like Chord of Calling to tutor for key creatures like Cauldron Familiar and Samwise Gamgee, which can generate value and synergies with other cards in the deck. The deck also includes sacrifice outlets like Viscera Seer to support combos, along with mana acceleration from cards like Gilded Goose and Birthing Ritual. By assembling the right pieces at the right time, this deck can generate explosive plays and overwhelm opponents.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disruption and card advantage through counterspells, removal, and card draw. The key strategy is to control the board with Counterspell and Fatal Push, while using Murktide Regent to pressure the opponent. By efficiently managing resources and disrupting the opponent's plans, this deck aims to outvalue and outlast its opponent until it can secure the win condition through card advantage and tempo swings. The inclusion of various removal spells and disruptive creatures allows the deck to adapt to different matchups and strategies, making it a versatile and powerful control deck in the Modern format.
